avalancheActivity.comment: As a result of daytime warming and solar radiation, isolated small-sized glide-snow avalanches are still possible on steep, smooth slopes which have not yet discharged. Glide cracks are signals of potential imminent danger.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Not much snow. Low avalanche danger.

snowpackStructure.comment: During a night of star-studded skies, a breakable-to-capable of bearing loads crust can be generated. During the course of the day, it softens up particularly on sunny slopes and at lower altitudes. South-facing slopes are becoming bare of snow up to high altitudes.

tendency.highlights: Little change is expected, avalanche danger remains low

weatherForecast.comment: On Saturday, brilliantly sunny mountain weather is anticipated right from the start. Mild temperatures are expected in the mountains, the zero-degree level at 2700m. Temperatures at 2000m: up to +4 degreres; at 3000m: -2 degrees. High-altitude winds: westerly to southesterly, blowing at light strength

avalancheActivity.comment: Avalanches can be triggered in the persistent weak layer in isolated cases above about 2400m on very steep shady slopes. These releases usually are small-sized. The risks of injuries from being forced to take a fall outweigh those of being buried in snow masses. As a result of daytime warming and solar radiation, isolated, generally small-sized glide-snow avalanches are still possible on steep slopes which have not yet discharged. Glide cracks are signals of possibly imminent danger.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Isolated glide-snow avalanches. Isolated danger zones in persistent weak layers

snowpackStructure.comment: During a night of star-studded skies, a breakable-to-capable of bearing loads crust can be generated. During the course of the day, it softens up particularly on sunny slopes and at lower altitudes. South-facing slopes are becoming bare of snow up to high altitudes. On shady high-altitude slopes above 2400m, isolated weak layers occur inside the snowpack.

weatherForecast.comment: On Saturday, brilliantly sunny mountain weather is anticipated right from the start. Mild temperatures are expected in the mountains, the zero-degree level at 2700m. Temperatures at 2000m: up to +4 degrees; at 3000m: -2 degrees. High-altitude winds: westerly to southesterly, blowing at light strength
